subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] The Research Must Move Forward (it's a long post but important please read)
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_905e864a-d1a2-465a-b760-650a4bd3c891_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Stefan,
 
Myself as well as Steve have been asking questions along the lin=
es of communication advancement since day one.
The problem is we have never=
 received any concrete answers, advice or instruction.
 
In the beginning w=
e did work with technicians and guides on a daily basis Steve and I had the=
 same two techs assigned to us both, Mike and Lisa.
We had developed a grea=
t communication as well as personal relationship with them. As much as coul=
d be developed given the circumstances.
 
About two months ago we all start=
ed to lose contact with our techs and guides, and as far as my communicatio=
n goes and a few other researchers I have discussed this with
The techs are=
 no longer running this communication and contact with them is sporadic and=
 rare. I will hear from Lisa some times but never Mike any more.
 
When que=
stioned the communicating spirits where of course vague in their answers bu=
t more or less explained the techs had moved on.
Possibly we had outgrown t=
heir supervision or they moved on to assist in other areas of communication=
 or simply to continue their spiritual journey's.
We may never know for sur=
e. But that is the tech situation.
 
As far as psychic mediums go, I do bel=
ieve they have some sort of gift, but their communication is based solely o=
n intuition and interpretation rather than actual real time hard line commu=
nication
I think it is more thought and feeling than communication.
 
My op=
inion and that's all it is. Is that our answers and future lye in developin=
g our technology and strength of knowledge and real time communication with=
 other entities that are willing.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.comFrom: yahoogroups@...: Mon, 21 Apr 2008 17:20:35 =
+0200Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The Research Must Move Forward (it's a long pos=
t but important please read)




Hi Bruce,my suggestion is to use our curre=
nt communication methods to attempt to get in contact with a spirit group o=
f technicians/researchers and ask them for advice to improve the communicat=
ion. I think the best would be a kind of collaboration between both sides. =
Alternatively, perhaps the help of a medium might be useful.Stefan----- ori=
ginal Nachricht --------Betreff: [EVP-ITC] The Research Must Move Forward (=
it's a long post but important please read)Gesendet: Mo, 21. Apr 2008Von: b=
hali333<paranormalinvestigating@...>> > Hi Everyone,> > I would lik=
e to make a serious suggestion.> As a senior researcher in the live spirit =
communication field, Myself > and a few other researchers here such as Stev=
e hultay, Ann, LC> Just to mention a couple have strived since the beginnin=
g to try and > advance the technology, communication and relations with our=
 spirit > friends or whatever entities are participating in this communicat=
ion > research.> > In order to call this research it must continue to move =
forward.> There are more than enough of the new people here, that do not > =
qualify as new people anymore. But full fledged researchers. Of > course th=
ey have much to learn, but so do we all.> > Which brings me to my suggestio=
n.> Steve and I have recently been discussing the point we have reached > i=
n the research, both in process and knowledge. We agreed on most > points,>=
 the most important one being. It is time to move beyond the same > mundane=
 session content and the same rudimentary line of questioning.> > This rese=
arch is stagnating for lack of direction, any posted files > or discussions=
 revolve around the same stale subjects such as, > "Is there anyone there t=
hat wishes to communicate", > "What is your name"> "who am I speaking with"=
> "what is it like where you are"> > I believe we have all received every c=
ombination of answer to those > questions that we possibly can, yet we cont=
inue to ask them session > after session. And still become amazed at a yes =
or no answer or the > simplest of phrases.> > I am not saying this about an=
y single level of researcher but all of > us myself included have fallen in=
to this rut. We are not learning > anything, All our efforts are amounting =
to nothing.> > We already know that we are communicating with someone or so=
mething. > I believe we have all come to believe that through our personal =
> research and the evidence presented by all of us.> > Within the last year=
 the technology and potential of this type of > research has exceeded all e=
xpectations in it's quality and speed of > development. We are actually let=
ting it go to waste.> > I and a few other researchers believe that whoever =
is on the other > side of the line has had a hand in some of us developing =
this new > equipment and methods of research be it obvious or subtle.> > Bu=
t our methods of research have not excelled, we are conducting > research i=
n the same manner as we did when there where only about 5 > of us in the wh=
ole world actively doing this research.> > New individuals are joining our =
ranks and becoming interested in box > research every day. The protocol the=
y are being instructed to use is > antiquated and obsolete.> > It is fine t=
o teach them these methods as a basic foundation of the > research and to g=
et their feet wet. But like any other education > process it must evolve an=
d develop with the accumulation of knowledge.> > If we approached academic =
education the way we approach box research, > we would all still be in the =
first grade.> > I propose a committee to develop a method of research and p=
rotocol > that can deal with the ever evolving technology and decide what a=
nd > how we should approach the type of communication we seek and the > sub=
ject matter that should be addressed, that will be continually > changing.>=
 > Only in this way will the wheels of research and learning move > forward=
 and we will gain the knowledge we seek and hopefully be able > to share it=
 with the world someday.> > But if we continue to ask "Is anyone there will=
ing to speak with me"> We are doomed.> > Anyone that wishes to discuss this=
 and give opinions or suggestions> please lets try and get started every mi=
nute we waste is a missed > opportunity for learning.> > Bruce> > > -------=

chricht Ende ----

Stefan,<BR>
 <BR>
Myself as well as Steve have been asking=
 questions along the lines of communication advancement since day one.<BR>
=
The problem is we have never received any concrete answers, advice or instr=
uction.<BR>
 <BR>
In the beginning we did work with technicians and gu=
ides on a daily basis Steve and I had the same two techs assigned to us bot=
h, Mike and Lisa.<BR>
We had developed a great communication as well as per=
sonal relationship with them. As much as could be developed given the circu=
mstances.<BR>
 <BR>
About two months ago we all started to lose c=
ontact with our techs and guides, and as far as my communication goes =
and a few other researchers I have discussed this with<BR>
The techs are no=
 longer running this communication and contact with them is sporadic and ra=
re. I will hear from Lisa some times but never Mike any more.<BR>
 <BR=
>
When questioned the communicating spirits where of course vague in their =
answers but more or less explained the techs had moved on.<BR>
Possibly we =
had outgrown their supervision or they moved on to assist in other areas of=
 communication or simply to continue their spiritual journey's.<BR>
We may =
never know for sure. But that is the tech situation.<BR>
 <BR>
As far =
as psychic mediums go, I do believe they have some sort of gift, but their =
communication is based solely on intuition and interpretation rather t=
han actual real time hard line communication<BR>
I think it is more thought=
 and feeling than communication.<BR>
 <BR>
My opinion and that's all i=
t is. Is that our answers and future lye in developing our technology and s=
trength of knowledge and real time communication with other entities that a=
re willing.<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<BR><BR><BR>

Hi Bruce,<BR><BR>my suggestion is to use our current c=
ommunication methods to attempt to get in contact with a spirit group of te=
chnicians/<WBR>researchers and ask them for advice to improve the communica=
tion. I think the best would be a kind of collaboration between both sides.=
 Alternatively, perhaps the help of a medium might be useful.<BR><BR>Stefan=
<BR><BR>----- original Nachricht --------<BR><BR>Betreff: [EVP-ITC] The Res=
earch Must Move Forward (it's a long post but important please read)<BR>Ges=
endet: Mo, 21. Apr 2008<BR>Von: bhali333<<A href=3D"mailto:paranormalinv=
estigating@...">paranormalinvestiga<WBR>ting@hotmail.<WBR>com</A>&g=
t;<BR><BR>> <BR>> Hi Everyone,<BR>> <BR>> I would like to make =
a serious suggestion.<BR>> As a senior researcher in the live spirit com=
munication field, Myself <BR>> and a few other researchers here such as =
Steve hultay, Ann, LC<BR>> Just to mention a couple have strived since t=
he beginning to try and <BR>> advance the technology, communication and =
relations with our spirit <BR>> friends or whatever entities are partici=
pating in this communication <BR>> research.<BR>> <BR>> In order t=
o call this research it must continue to move forward.<BR>> There are mo=
re than enough of the new people here, that do not <BR>> qualify as new =
people anymore. But full fledged researchers. Of <BR>> course they have =
much to learn, but so do we all.<BR>> <BR>> Which brings me to my sug=
gestion.<BR>> Steve and I have recently been discussing the point we hav=
e reached <BR>> in the research, both in process and knowledge. We agree=
d on most <BR>> points,<BR>> the most important one being. It is time=
 to move beyond the same <BR>> mundane session content and the same rudi=
mentary line of questioning.<BR>> <BR>> This research is stagnating f=
or lack of direction, any posted files <BR>> or discussions revolve arou=
nd the same stale subjects such as, <BR>> "Is there anyone there that wi=
shes to communicate"<WBR>, <BR>> "What is your name"<BR>> "who am I s=
peaking with"<BR>> "what is it like where you are"<BR>> <BR>> I be=
lieve we have all received every combination of answer to those <BR>> qu=
estions that we possibly can, yet we continue to ask them session <BR>> =
after session. And still become amazed at a yes or no answer or the <BR>&gt=
; simplest of phrases.<BR>> <BR>> I am not saying this about any sing=
le level of researcher but all of <BR>> us myself included have fallen i=
nto this rut. We are not learning <BR>> anything, All our efforts are am=
ounting to nothing.<BR>> <BR>> We already know that we are communicat=
ing with someone or something. <BR>> I believe we have all come to belie=
ve that through our personal <BR>> research and the evidence presented b=
y all of us.<BR>> <BR>> Within the last year the technology and poten=
tial of this type of <BR>> research has exceeded all expectations in it'=
s quality and speed of <BR>> development. We are actually letting it go =
to waste.<BR>> <BR>> I and a few other researchers believe that whoev=
er is on the other <BR>> side of the line has had a hand in some of us d=
eveloping this new <BR>> equipment and methods of research be it obvious=
 or subtle.<BR>> <BR>> But our methods of research have not excelled,=
 we are conducting <BR>> research in the same manner as we did when ther=
e where only about 5 <BR>> of us in the whole world actively doing this =
research.<BR>> <BR>> New individuals are joining our ranks and becomi=
ng interested in box <BR>> research every day. The protocol they are bei=
ng instructed to use is <BR>> antiquated and obsolete.<BR>> <BR>> =
It is fine to teach them these methods as a basic foundation of the <BR>&gt=
; research and to get their feet wet. But like any other education <BR>>=
 process it must evolve and develop with the accumulation of knowledge.<BR>=
> <BR>> If we approached academic education the way we approach box r=
esearch, <BR>> we would all still be in the first grade.<BR>> <BR>&gt=
; I propose a committee to develop a method of research and protocol <BR>&g=
t; that can deal with the ever evolving technology and decide what and <BR>=
> how we should approach the type of communication we seek and the <BR>&=
gt; subject matter that should be addressed, that will be continually <BR>&=
gt; changing.<BR>> <BR>> Only in this way will the wheels of research=
 and learning move <BR>> forward and we will gain the knowledge we seek =
and hopefully be able <BR>> to share it with the world someday.<BR>> =
<BR>> But if we continue to ask "Is anyone there willing to speak with m=
e"<BR>> We are doomed.<BR>> <BR>> Anyone that wishes to discuss th=
is and give opinions or suggestions<BR>> please lets try and get started=
 every minute we waste is a missed <BR>> opportunity for learning.<BR>&g=
t; <BR>> Bruce<BR>> <BR>> <BR>> ------------<WBR>---------<WBR>=
---------<WBR>------<BR>> <BR>> Yahoo! Groups Links<BR>> <BR>> =
